{{also|Vier|vièr}} ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{affix|en|vie|-er}}. ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # One who [[vie]]s for something. #* '''1991''', Diane Lynch Fraser, ''Playdancing'' (page 90) #*: Evidently, there were two children vying for a third's attention. The two attention '''viers''' were engaged in a series of gymnastic feats on a small portable trampoline. Two girls were trying to outdo each other to impress the third child, a boy. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=eirv|Iver|iver|rive|vire}} ---- ==Afrikaans== {{cardinalbox|af|3|4|5|drie|vyf|ord=vierde}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|af|nl|vier}}, from {{inh|af|dum|vier}}, from {{inh|af|odt|viuwar}}, {{m|odt|vier}}, from {{inh|af|gem-pro|*fedwōr}}, from {{inh|af|ine-pro|*kʷetwṓr}}, the neuter form of {{m|ine-pro|*kʷetwóres}}. ===Numeral=== {{head|af|numeral|cat2=cardinal numbers}} # [[four]] ---- ==Alemannic German== {{enum|gsw|drüü|foif|cardinal number|4}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gsw|gmh|vier}}, from {{inh|gsw|goh|fior}}, from {{inh|gsw|gem-pro|*fedwōr}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|vier}}, {{cog|nl|vier}}, {{cog|en|four}}, {{cog|is|fjórir}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|gsw|/fiər/}} ===Numeral=== {{head|gsw|numeral|cat2=cardinal numbers}} # [[four]] ---- ==Central Franconian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gmw-cfr|goh|fior}}, from {{inh|gmw-cfr|gem-pro|*fedwōr}}, from {{inh|gmw-cfr|ine-pro|*kʷetwóres}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|gmw-cfr|/fiə̯/}} ===Numeral=== {{head|gmw-cfr|numeral}} # {{lb|gmw-cfr|most dialects}} [[four]] ---- ==Dutch== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nl|/vir/|[viːr]|[viər]}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-vier (Belgium).ogg|audio (Belgium)}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-vier.ogg|audio (Netherlands)}} * {{hyphenation|nl|vier}} * {{rhymes|nl|ir}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|nl|dum|vier}}, from {{inh|nl|odt|viuwar}}, {{m|odt|vier}}, from {{inh|nl|gem-pro|*fedwōr}}, from {{inh|nl|ine-pro|*kʷetwṓr}}, the neuter form of {{m|ine-pro|*kʷetwóres}}. ====Numeral==== {{cardinalbox|nl|3|4|5|drie|vijf|ord=vierde}} {{head|nl|numeral}} # {{cln|nl|cardinal numbers}} [[four]] =====Derived terms===== * {{l|nl|klavertjevier}} * {{l|nl|vierling}} * {{l|nl|viertal}} =====Related terms===== * {{l|nl|veertien}} * {{l|nl|veertig}} * {{l|nl|vierde}} =====Descendants===== * {{desc|af|vier}} ===Etymology 2=== {{nonlemma}} ====Verb==== {{head|nl|verb form}} # {{nl-verb form of|p=1|n=sg|t=pres|m=ind|vieren}} # {{nl-verb form of|m=imp|vieren}} ---- ==German== {{cardinalbox|de|3|4|5|drei|fünf|ord=vierte}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|fior}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*fedwōr}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*kʷetwṓr}}, the neuter form of {{m|ine-pro|*kʷetwóres}}. Compare {{cog|nl|vier}}, {{cog|en|four}}, {{cog|da|fire}}, {{cog|sv|fyra}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/fiːɐ̯/}} * {{audio|de|De-vier.ogg|audio}} * {{rhymes|de|iːɐ̯}} ===Numeral=== {{head|de|numeral|cat2=cardinal numbers}} # [[four]] {{gloss|numerical value represented by the Arabic numeral 4; or ''describing a set with four elements''}} #* '''1682''', Benignus Kybler, ''WunderSpiegl Oder Göttliche Wunderwerck. Dritter und letzter Theil'', p. 144: #*: {{quote|de|Bey Ablauffung der fünfften Wochen/ erschine ihr die Himmel-Königin abermahlen/ vnd raichet ein Himmlisches Getranck dar/ welches sie mit allgebürender Ehrerbütigkeit angenommen vnd genossen/ zumahlen sich dermassen erhollet hat / daß ihre Stärcke vnnd Leibs-Kräften weit grösser dann zuvoren/ nit leicht auch von '''vieren''' Männern kundte überwunden werden.|When the fifth week end / the heavenly queen appeared to her again / and gave her a heavenly drink / that she accepted with appropriate reverence and enjoyed / so that she recreated so much, / that her strength and health were much higher than before / and couldn't easily be overcome by '''four''' men.}} ====Declension==== Normally uninflected, but note the following: * {{m|de|viere}} {{q|now colloquial|used independently of a noun}}, e.g. ''Die Turmuhr schlug '''viere'''.'' ― The clock tower struck '''four'''. * genitive: {{m|de|vierer}} {{q|literary}}, e.g. ''nach Verlauf '''vierer''' Jahre'' ― after the course of '''four''' years * dative: {{m|de|vieren}} {{q|literary|now used independently of a noun}}, e.g. ''der letzte von '''vieren''''' ― the last of '''four''' ====Coordinate terms==== {{de-cardinal}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Vierzeiler}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|vierte}} * {{l|de|vierzehn}} * {{l|de|vierzig}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Latin== ===Verb=== {{la-verb-form|vier}} #
